supporting_quotes: She earned a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Colorado at Boulder in 1976.
Sheeran got her start in journalism in 1976 with the New York News World
She served in a number of capacities for News World, eventually becoming their White House correspondent.
In 1982, she moved to News World's new sister paper, The Washington Times. Originally a features editor, she was eventually appointed managing editor.
She has twice served as a Pulitzer Prize juror.
Sheeran also served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Empower America, where she developed its agenda of trade policy, technology policy, education reform, and tax reform
Before joining USTR, Sheeran was managing director of Starpoint Solutions, a Wall Street technology firm that works with Fortune 500 clients.

organizations: Office of the U.S. Trade Representative
supporting_quotes: She served as Ambassador and Deputy U.S. Trade Representative under President George Bush, covering all Asia, Africa and Intellectual Property, Technology and Agriculture from 2001-2005.
Prior to her tenure as Under Secretary, Sheeran served as Deputy United States Trade Representative in the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative (USTR).

roles: Under Secretary of State for Economic, Business, and Agricultural Affairs
